result.execSummary:
The defendant Todd J. Derks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intentionally Abuse Hazardous Substance [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.316(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: The Defendant is to undergo any counseling the agent finds appropriate and must comply with any recommended treatment/assessment/counseling.  The Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - no alcohol or drugs unless prescribed by a physician.  The Defendant is to take any medications as prescribed by a physician or psychiatrist.  The Defendant is to obtain and maintain full time employment and/or educational programming as recommended.  The Defendant is not to go into any bars, taverns or businesses where the primary purpose is to sell alcohol.  The Defendant is not to use or be in possession of compressed air.  After the first 6 months of probation, defendant is to write an apology letter to wife and sons advising them of the progress he has made.  Submit for the Agent's review and provide a copy to the Court.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due, and/or other collection means, such as income assignment will be issued.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Todd J. Derks

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
